original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down on mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka‘s shares edge down in mid day trade on Wednesday, as investors adopt a wait and see approach followed by a stagnant market on further clarity on debt restructuring and optimization, an analyst said.
“The market is not condensed with high volumes and is stagnant on a wait and see approach with regard to firmer news on debt restructuring and optimization,” an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) was down 0.08 percent  or 6.83 points to 8,907.91, S&P SL20 was down 0.14 percent or 3.35 points to 2,600.94.
The market generated a turnover of 293 million rupees at 1200 hours.
“Level of turnover is poor, so there is no panic selling,” an analyst said.
Top losers during mid day trade were Vallibel One, John Keells Holdings and DFCC Bank. (Colombo/May10/2023)
